conclusion: Electric field due to a point charge q at a distance r is given by E = kq/r^2.
Charges +q at A and B, and -q at C and D are placed at vertices of square ABCD.
Side length of square is L, and intersection of diagonals is the center of the square.
Distance from any vertex to the center of the square is r = L/sqrt(2).
Electric field due to +q at A is E_A = 2kq/L^2 along diagonal AC.
Electric field due to +q at B is E_B = 2kq/L^2 along diagonal BD.
Electric field due to -q at C is E_C = -2kq/L^2 along diagonal AC.
Electric field due to -q at D is E_D = -2kq/L^2 along diagonal BD.
Total electric field at the center is E_total = E_A + E_C + E_B + E_D = 0.
Electric fields E_A and E_B will cancel out E_C and E_D in the direction perpendicular to the diagonals.
Net electric field at the intersection of the diagonals is zero.
